journeys.description: This is the description for journey 1

Mt. Everest is the tallest mountain in the world standing at 29,029 feet above sea level. It sits on the Nepal/Tibet border and is part of the Himalayan Mountain Range. Mt. Everest was first officially summited in 1953 by Sir Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay.
This is the description for journey 2

Mount Fuji is a 12,389 foot active volcano located on Honshu Island, Japan. It is the tallest peak in Japan and has been the subject of art and literature for centuries. The top of Mount Fuji is actually part of the Fujisan HongÅ« Sengen Taisha, a massive Shinto shrine. The Mt. Fuji area is incredibly scenic consisting of: the Five Fuji Lakes, a number of waterfalls, hot springs, and miles of Cherry Blossoms.

The Appalachian Trail is a hiking trail located in the Eastern United States. The trail crosses through 14 states; extending roughly 2,200 miles between Springer Mountain in Georgia and Mount Katahdin in Maine. There are campsites, resupply stations, and miles of wilderness all maintained by the Appalachian Trail Conservancy (ATC).

The Great Wall of China is located in Northern China along the historical Northern border of the county. It was originally built to keep the Mongol tribes from invading China. With all its various branches the Great Wall spans over 13,000 miles.
